ChartType.name: ChartType
ChartType.definition:
| 'Area'
  | 'AreaStacked' // Area chart with values stacked
  | 'AreaStacked100' // Area chart with values stacked to show percentages
  | 'Bar'
  | 'BarStacked' // Bar chart with values stacked side by side
  | 'BarStacked100' // Bar chart with values stacked to show percentages
  | 'ColumnClustered' // Regular column chart with groups side by side
  | 'ColumnStacked' // Column chart with values stacked on top of each other
  | 'ColumnStacked100' // Column chart with values stacked to show percentages
  | 'Doughnut'
  | 'Funnel' // Funnel chart for process flow visualization (stages and values)
  | 'Line'
  | 'LineStacked' // Line chart with values stacked
  | 'LineStacked100' // Line chart with values stacked to show percentages
  | 'Pie'
  | 'Radar'
  | 'Treemap' // Treemap chart for hierarchical data visualization
  | 'Waterfall' // Waterfall chart for cumulative value analysis
  | 'XYScatter' // Basic scatter chart with markers
  | 'XYScatterLines' // Scatter chart with lines and markers
  | 'XYScatterLinesNoMarkers' // Scatter chart with lines but no markers
  | 'XYScatterSmooth' // Scatter chart with smoothed lines and markers
  | 'XYScatterSmoothNoMarkers'

name.docstring: Get the name of the chart

dataRange.docstring: Get the data range formula string

getAPIInfo.docstring:
Retrieves complete API documentation for a function, including function signature, parameters and return type.
The returned documentation includes docstring, complete function signature with parameters and return types, and all parameter type definitions used by the function.
IMPORTANT: Always prefer spreadsheet features (pivot tables, tables, conditional formats) over hardcoding values and styles for dynamic updates.
IMPORTANT: NEVER guess the API of the functions below. Read and console.log the documentation in FULL without any truncations.

Merging/unmerging cells: addSpanAt, removeSpanAt
Sizing/visibility: setRowVisibleAt, setColumnVisibleAt, setRowHeightAt, getRowHeightAt, setRowResizableAt, setColumnResizableAt
Sheet dimensions: setTotalRowCount, setTotalColumnCount, getTotalRowCount, getTotalColumnCount
  - CRITICAL: SpreadJS initializes sheets with 50K rows and 200 columns. Writing to cells beyond these limits will SILENTLY FAIL unless you expand first!
  - Example: sheet.expandSheetToFit("A60000"); sheet.setCell("A60000", "data");
Conditional formatting: applyConditionalFormatting, removeConditionalFormatting, clearAllConditionalFormatting
Tables: addTable, removeTable, getTable, listTables, clearTableFilters
Data validation: setDataValidation, removeDataValidation
Freeze panes: freezeFirstRows, freezeFirstColumns, unfreezeAllPanes
Goal Seek: goalSeek
Named ranges: getNamedRangeInfo, addNamedRange, removeNamedRange
Pivot tables: addPivotTable, removePivotTable, listPivotTables, getPivotTableHandle (returns PivotTableHandle for modifications)
  - IMPORTANT: For ANY user request involving pivot tables or pivot analysis, ALWAYS use addPivotTable for new pivot tables
  - IMPORTANT: For modifications to EXISTING pivot tables, use getPivotTableHandle(name) to get a PivotTableHandle, then call methods like addField(), removeField(), changeAggregation(), etc.
  - Use pt.getConfig() to inspect current pivot structure before modifying
  - Never attempt to manually recreate pivot table functionality with formulas. The pivot API handles all aggregation automatically
  - Common use cases: sales by region, totals by category, count by status, any "group by" analysis
Chart properties: setChartProperties, getChartProperties
@example general.getAPIInfo("applyConditionalFormatting");

Workbook.docstring: Workbook interface - you can reference this object via the "workbook" variable.

addSheet.docstring: Sheet name must not contain special characters like \ / ? * [ ] :. Never add sheets with a space. Always use underscores or hyphens. Does not add sheet if sheet with same name already exists.

moveSheet.docstring: Move sheet with specified name to the specified index.

getRowRange.docstring: Get Excel range for an entire row

removeSheet.docstring: Remove a sheet at the specified index. If operating on a blank workbook, make sure to remove sheet1 if you are adding new sheets.

addNamedRange.signature: addNamedRange(name: string, reference: string, comment?: string): void;

getSheetCount.docstring: Get the total number of sheets in the workbook

addressToIndex.docstring: Convert Excel address to zero-based row and column indices
addressToIndex.signature: addressToIndex(address: string): { row: number; col: number };

getColumnRange.docstring: Get Excel range for an entire column

indexToAddress.docstring: Converts raw zero-based row and column indices to Excel address

getSheetFromName.docstring: Get a sheet by name - this is the most reliable way to get a sheet

getNamedRangeInfo.docstring:
Get information about all named ranges defined in the workbook.
@example console.log(workbook.getNamedRangeInfo());

setActiveSheetIndex.docstring: Set the active sheet by index

setGridlinesForAllSheets.docstring: Toggle whether to show or hide gridlines for all sheets

addNote.docstring: Add a note to a cell. Notes show a red triangle indicator in the corner.

getCell.docstring: Get a formatted / printable string representation of the cell, including the formatted value, formula and style of a cell. If the cell is 0 and is displayed in other formats (e.g. banking, "$ -"), [0] will be appended to the output for clarity.

getName.docstring: Get the name of the sheet

getNote.docstring: Get the note from a cell, or null if none exists.

setCell.docstring:
Set the value and format of a cell, takes an excel address like "A1", if it is a formula, write it as =SUM(A1:A5).

- If you need to reference a formula from another sheet, you can use the format "Sheet1!A1".
- When using setCell, preserve data types. Numbers should NOT be quoted:
  - CORRECT: sheet.setCell("A1", 8000) - number without quotes
  - WRONG: sheet.setCell("A1", "8000") - this makes it text!
  - For formulas use: sheet.setCell("A1", "=SUM(B1:B10)") - formulas need quotes
  - With format and note: sheet.setCell("A1", 8000, FormatType.Currency, "Revenue from Q1") - adds a note to the cell
setCell.signature: setCell(address: string, value: any, numberFormat?: FormatType | string, note?: string): void;

setName.docstring: Set the name of the sheet

visible.docstring: Show or hide the entire sheet

addTable.signature: addTable(range: string, tableName: string, hasHeaders: boolean, style?: string): Table;

autoFill.signature: autoFill(sourceRange: string, targetRange: string, fillMode?: 'constant' | 'auto'): void;

getChart.docstring: Get a chart by name (returns null if not found).

getIndex.docstring: Get the sheetIndex of the sheet, especially useful when you need to reference a sheet by index

goalSeek.signature: goalSeek(variableAddress: string, formulaAddress: string, goalValue: number): boolean;

addRowsAt.docstring: Add rows at the specified row address.

addSpanAt.docstring: Merge a range starting from the cell at address (e.g., "A1")
addSpanAt.signature: addSpanAt(address: string, rowCount: number, colCount: number): void;

clearData.docstring: Clears data, but not style and formatting, from a cell range

addPicture.signature: addPicture(name: string, base64Data: string, anchorCell: string): Promise<void>;

listCharts.docstring: Get all chart names in the sheet.

listTables.docstring: List all tables in the sheet.

removeNote.docstring: Remove the note from a cell.

setStyleAt.docstring:
Apply a style to a range. Merges with existing style by default; set overwrite=true to replace.
@example sheet.setStyleAt("A1:B10", { backColor: "red", borderTop: { color: "blue", style: LineStyle.medium } });
setStyleAt.signature: setStyleAt(range: string, style: Style, overwrite?: boolean): void;

getRowCount.docstring: Get the total number of rows in the sheet, even if they were not included in context

regexSearch.docstring: Search with multiple regex patterns, returns addresses and values

removeChart.docstring: Remove a chart from the worksheet.

removeTable.docstring: Remove a table by name. Use instead of clearing cells individually. Note this clears the table formatting, but not the data.

addColumnsAt.docstring: Add columns at the specified column letter.

deleteRowsAt.docstring: Delete rows at the specified row address.

getCellRange.docstring:
Returns a range of cells with address, formatted value, formula (if any), and style in a markdown-esque representation.
If the cell is 0 and is displayed in other formats (e.g. accounting, "$ -"), [0] will be appended to the output for clarity.
Use this to examine specific cells in detail. Limit to 3000 cells.

getUsedRange.docstring: Get the used range of the sheet

removeSpanAt.docstring: Unmerge previously merged range starting from the cell at address

getCellFormat.docstring: Get the exact format of a cell.

getColumnCount.docstring: Get the total number of columns in the sheet, even if they were not included in context

getRawCellData.docstring: Get raw data value from a cell, preserving data type. Set formula=true to get the formula instead of value.

getRowHeightAt.docstring:
Get current height (in px) for the given row.
@example getRowHeightAt("1");

setRowHeightAt.docstring:
Set explicit height (in px) for the given row.
@example setRowHeightAt("1", 100);

autoFitColumnAt.docstring: Auto-fit the column specified by columnLetter.

clearFormatting.docstring: Clears style and formatting, but not data, from a cell range

deleteColumnsAt.docstring: Delete columns at the specified column letter.

getRawRangeData.docstring: Get raw data for a range as 2D array. Always returns 2D array even for single row/column.

getSheetSummary.docstring:
Get an overview of the sheet including name, dimensions, used ranges.
@param includeData - If true, it will include the data in the sheet

listPivotTables.docstring:
Get a list of all pivot tables in the sheet.
@returns Array of objects with basic info (name, contentArea, filterArea) - NOT handles
listPivotTables.signature: listPivotTables(): { name: string; contentArea: string; filterArea: string }[];

getColumnWidthAt.docstring: Get the width of a column in pixels.

removePivotTable.docstring:
Remove a pivot table by name.
@param name - The string name of the pivot table to remove (e.g., "SalesPivot")

setColumnWidthAt.docstring:
Set explicit width (in px) for the given column.
@example setColumnWidthAt("A", 100);

unfreezeAllPanes.docstring:
Removes all frozen panes from the sheet.
@example sheet.unfreezeAllPanes();

clearTableFilters.docstring: Clear the filters of a table by name.

getDependentCells.docstring: Get all cells that depend on the given cell

setDataValidation.signature:
setDataValidation(
    range: string,
    validationType: DataValidationType,
    operator?: DataValidationOperator,
    options?: DataValidationOptions,
    errorStyle?: DataValidationErrorStyle
  ): void;

setRowResizableAt.docstring:
Enable/disable manual resize for a row.
@example setRowResizableAt("1", true);

setChartProperties.docstring:
Modify chart properties. Only specified properties will be changed.
Can be used on any existing chart, either after addChart() or to update a chart created earlier.

removeDataValidation.docstring:
Remove data validation from a range of cells.
@param range - The Excel range to remove validation from (e.g., "A1:B10")

setColumnResizableAt.docstring:
Enable/disable manual resize for a column.
@example setColumnResizableAt("A", true);

getAllSpecializedCells.docstring:
Gets summarized, row-by-row breakdowns of cells categorized by hardcoded values, formulas, references to other sheets, and percentage-formatted cells.
Useful to proofread for hard-coded values and also for knowing which ranges to apply formatting to.

removeConditionalFormatting.docstring: Remove all conditional formatting from range

clearAllConditionalFormatting.docstring: Clear all conditional formatting from the sheet.

ChartProperties.docstring:
Chart properties for reading and modifying chart configuration.
All properties are optional - only specified properties will be changed when modifying.

position.docstring: Cell address to position the chart's top-left corner, e.g., "A26"

valueAxis.docstring: Value axis (Y-axis for most charts) configuration

dataLabels.docstring: Data labels configuration (SpreadJS only, ignored on other platforms)

categoryAxis.docstring: Category axis (X-axis for most charts) configuration

seriesColors.docstring:
Array of colors for chart data, e.g., ["#4E79A7", "#F28E2B", "#E15759"].
For bar/line/area charts, colors each series. For pie/doughnut charts, colors each slice.

dataOrientation.docstring:
Toggle data orientation (write-only). Equivalent to "Switch Row/Column" in Excel.
WARNING: This is a toggle operation - when set to any value, it switches orientation.
The actual value is ignored. Not idempotent.

PivotTableConfig.docstring:
Configuration for pivot tables - used both for creating (addPivotTable) and reading (getConfig).

When creating: name, dataSource, and field arrays are required.
When reading: contentArea and filterArea are populated with the pivot table's current ranges.

NOT to be confused with PivotTableHandle, which is the OBJECT returned by getPivotTableHandle()
for operating on an existing pivot table.

PivotTableHandle.docstring:
Handle object for interacting with an existing pivot table.
Returned by sheet.getPivotTableHandle(name).

This is an OBJECT with methods - use it to query or modify the pivot table:
- getName() - get the pivot table name
- getConfig() - get current fields and settings (returns PivotTableConfig)
- addField() / removeField() - modify row/column/filter fields
- addValueField() - add aggregated value fields
- changeAggregation() / renameValueField() - modify value fields
- refresh() - refresh from source data

refresh.docstring: Refresh to reflect source data changes

addField.docstring: Add a field to row, column, or filter area
addField.signature: addField(field: string, area: 'row' | 'column' | 'filter', position?: number): void;

getConfig.docstring: Get the current configuration including all fields

removeField.docstring: Remove a field by name or label

addValueField.docstring: Add a value field with aggregation

changeAggregation.docstring: Change aggregation for a value field
